pullRequest.body:
The definition of `PowerSeries.invOneSubPow` has been changed into the following:
Given a commutative ring `S` and a number `d : ℕ`, `PowerSeries.invOneSubPow S d` is the multiplicative inverse of `(1 - X) ^ d` in `S⟦X⟧ˣ`. When `d` is `0`, `PowerSeries.invOneSubPow S d` will just be `1`. When `d` is positive, `PowerSeries.invOneSubPow S d` will be `∑ n, Nat.choose (d - 1 + n) (d - 1)`.

### PR summary [90050d4146](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17360/commits/90050d4146d07eccfe0b40bf99d46989de9396c4)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ invOneSubPow_inv_eq_one_of_eq_zero`
`+ invOneSubPow_val_eq_mk_sub_one_add_choose_of_pos`
`+ invOneSubPow_val_one_eq_invUnitSub_one`
`+ invOneSubPow_val_succ_eq_mk_add_choose`
`+ invOneSubPow_zero_val_eq_one`
`+ mk_add_choose_mul_one_sub_pow_eq_one`
`- invOneSubPow_val_eq_mk_choose_add`
`- invOneSubPow_val_zero_eq_invUnitSub_one`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

Is there a reason not to use
```suggestion
theorem invOneSubPow_zero_val_eq_one : (invOneSubPow S 0).val = 1 := by
```
?

More readable as
```suggestion
    invOneSubPow S d =
      (Units.mkOfMulEqOne (1 - X) (mk 1 : S⟦X⟧) <|
        Eq.trans (mul_comm _ _) (mk_one_mul_one_sub_eq_one S))⁻¹ ^ d := by
```

Either
```suggestion
      refine (DivisionMonoid.inv_eq_of_mul _ (invOneSubPow S (d + 1)) ?_).symm
      rw [← Units.val_eq_one, Units.val_mul, Units.val_pow_eq_pow_val]
      exact (invOneSubPow S (d + 1)).inv_val
```
or
```suggestion
      exact (DivisionMonoid.inv_eq_of_mul _ (invOneSubPow S (d + 1)) <| by
        rw [← Units.val_eq_one, Units.val_mul, Units.val_pow_eq_pow_val]
        exact (invOneSubPow S (d + 1)).inv_val).symm
```

pullRequest.title: feat(RingTheory/PowerSeries/WellKnown): changed `PowerSeries.invOneSubPow`
